Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: djtravelbug
Reviews.Content: Pros: - good value considering youre in Singapore - very helpful and well informed staff - free wifi internet - has a convenience store outside the lobby Cons: - cramped room, no cabinet - far from a subway station - shower leeks outside the bathroom still pros outweigh cons, will be back

Reviews.Title: “Helpful hotel staff and honest taxi driver”
Reviews.Author: chung s
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Value Hotel Balestier for 3 nights. We booked the hotel mainly to save money on accomodation, given that hotels at Singapore are really expensive! When we booked the room, we insisted on one with windows and we were given one. The location, Balestier Road, is a quiet, peaceful and easily assessible area, though it is not served by the MRT. We can get to Orchard Road by taking the bus in front of the hotel. The room was small, but generally clean and funiture and fittings basic but looks modern. We got what we expected of a budget hotel. The only drawback is there is no partition between the shower and the toilet bowl, so after bath, the toilet get very wet. The toilet is very small. But we were thankful to the hotel staff that night as on our arrival at around 11 pm, we found we had left our camera on the taxi that took us from the airport to the hotel. Staff on duty was very helpful and sympathetic. He called the major taxi companies to file our case. We were told that the chance was slim as we did not remember clearly the colour of the taxi as it was late at night( there are 8 taxi companies) and we did not get a receipt from the taxi driver (we should have). But to our pleasant surprise, at around 2 am, the very driver who drove us there took our bag back to the hotel!!! When asked how much we should pay as a reward, he said,' Doesn't matter! I take whatever you give!" This left us a very good memory of Singapore and we were really lucky to have met good people. Thank you Hotel Balestier and keep up with your good service! Salute!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ysliit
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel. The staff is friendly and supportive. Stranded room with no window is very clean, small and has a tiny bath room. Room don’t have much furniture so had to keep some stuff in side the luggage. Not very sound proof. The hotel area seems very good. Has a small bar in-front if your looking for a beer or so. Have about 3 to 4 food places around the hotel and convenience store in front of the hotel. There is bus stands(5 bus routes) in both sides of the road, right in-front of the hotel. Very good hotel if your planning very little time in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the Location”
Reviews.Author: JustinTexan
Reviews.Content: Too expensive for the small size of the room and the location. The room was clean with tv and A/C but just way too expensive for where it was. Too far from all the action to justify the price. I needed a 10-20 cab to get anywhere I wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Small Place for Sleep”
Reviews.Author: VictorDragono
Reviews.Content: Again as I only can stay at small hotel due lack of fund. This hotel is great, better than Thompson Value. But some old man still use that room to bring chicks inside. There's should be a regulation not to use a hotel for 'doing' something. Most of all I always have very good sleep in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Putri A
Reviews.Content: my first time staying at this hotel. the staff are friendly, the bed was comfortable, room and bathroom are VERY small but clean! (i took superior room with no window) location is fine, since the bus stop is just right in front of the hotel, you can also get a taxi from here. there is a 24hours convenience store in front of the hotel. don't stay in this hotel if you bring big luggages, coz there wont be any space for you to move in your room. stay for more than 4 nights in this hotel will give you headache too since the room is very small. lol

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Deni G
Reviews.Content: If it's your 1st time staying at Value Ballestier hotel, make sure you mention that it's the one near the expressway to the taxi driver. I simply told the taxi driver to take me to 'Value Ballestier hotel', the driver took me to 2 other Value hotels before getting the right one. Yup, those two are nearby. Should you need twin beds, DO NOT book the rooms with windows. Twin beds are only available in windowless rooms. I had to switch from the superior rooms to the ones without windows since I need two beds. I prepaid the rooms and no refund was made. Bus stop in front of the hotel is really convenient. Take bus 124 and 145 (if I don't remember them wrong), they'd take you to Orchard, even China Town. To get back, go to the bus stop at the back of Ngee Ann city, get bus 124 again; you should reach the hotel in 15-20 min. Bus fare is SGD 1.50, should be cheaper for kids/elderlies. Convenient store beside the hotel helps, too, should you need anything right away.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: SenLee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and overall it was satisfactory. 1) Location is good. The bus stop is right in front of the hotel. Bus no.124 will send you to Orchard Road only at S$1.30. Buses are frequent. Alternatively, Novena MRT station is approx. 10 mins walking distance away. 2) Room and bathroom is small. Not a concern to us as we spent most of the time outside visiting. 3) Check-in and check-out was done efficiently. No long wait. 4) Wifi in the room is available at S$10 per day. But I thought they should provide this FOC. 5) Room and bathroom is generally clean. However, cleanliness of the bathroom has to improve further. Linen and sheets are clean. Bed is comfortable. 6) Room does not have soundproofing wall. We stayed next to a noisy group of young people, playing their loud music which was pretty annoying. 7) Amenities in the room include LCD TV, electric kettle, mineral water, instant coffee, tea bags and hair dryer. 8) The drawback is only 1 socket outlet available in the room. Suggest to bring multi socket plug if you've got many devices to charge.

Reviews.Title: “Back again and again”
Reviews.Author: SwirlingTraveller
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel are the location, accessibility, convenience and food! The room generally has no frills. As long as you constantly remind yourself that this is a budget bed and breakfast, you'll do fine. I love the fact that there's a 24 hours convenient store just beside the hotel entrance. Its always good to know that you can buy food, drinks and your favourite paper at any time. Food is not a problem. Just 3 or 4 shop lots away, there's a coffee shop that serves one of the best Singapore bak kut teh (meat bone tea) I've tasted. And Balestier is a famous street for this local delight. So that's breakfast there every morning! Getting to Orchard Road for shopping was easy. The bus stop was just right in front of the hotel and its just a 15 mins bus ride away, depending on the traffic. For those who loves supper, you can drop off at Newton Circus, again just a 10 mins bus ride away. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “love the place”
Reviews.Author: Jizell D
Reviews.Content: we visited SG just recently,, i must say this hotel is cheap, nice people on the front desk,, next tym we visit, ill check in to this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “a rude front desk officer”
Reviews.Author: angelica m
Reviews.Content: d rooms r very small, if u r claustrophobic i advise u not to stay in this hotel. we encountered a very rude person in d front desk (a girl) while we were complaining about the rooms we got. we couldn't sleep because of the noise, we could hear people talking & banging of doors from the other rooms. when we asked for an extra pillow and comforter, they gave us used ones...this hotel sucks! the manager (a guy) is very helpful though. if u have complaints bout their services i suggest u look for the manager (a guy) and not the girl in d front desk (LG).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Service, Location hotel”
Reviews.Author: reimarquinto08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my mom and her friends. I could say that the hotel is nice, cheap and clean without compromising your safety. Front desk is also approachable and room amenities is also nice. Truly commendable service.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and clean place”
Reviews.Author: joswfina_edionisio
Reviews.Content: We never had a problem with our booking with Value Hotel Balestier even with a few days to go before leaving for singapore. We got lost the first time we got there because the signage was not as visible as the nearby hotels. Bus stop is just in front of the hotel but if you want to take the MRT, it is two bus stops away. The place is very clean and the staff are very accomodating. With a cozy bed, we had a good sleep after a long day. Though the place is a kinda small and not much room to move around. you will still feel relaxed and re-charged.

Reviews.Title: “Room with no view...”
Reviews.Author: growler202
Reviews.Content: After an arduous trip by train from KL and trying to win on a linguistic argument with a taxi driver whom I finally convinced I was visiting Singapore and did not know my way around, took me to the Value Hotel, assuring me the price would be budget. I don't know what planet this driver was from but he dropped me off at the Value Hotel. The rate was around HS$100 a night. I got a room without a window and the bed was comfortable. The only problem with this hotel is, it is located in the Hooker district and there was a lot of noise in the hall way. I could not afford another night at this hotel but was overall happy with the staff. Lots of food places around the area and only a S$6.00 taxi ride to Orchard Road. Be forewarned, Singapore is not the cheap duty free experience it was many years ago.

Reviews.Title: “value hotel...indeed”
Reviews.Author: fallen_angel024
Reviews.Content: we stay at this hotel every time we visit singapore(about 5 times in a year). the rates are cheap but the quality is not... it is conveniently located next to bus stop, shops and hawker's area... lobby is neat and the staff is efficient and friendly. they even let us dump our luggage after checking out for some time, while we go round singapore...there was even a time i asked for an hour extension but did not get charged for it...on a weekend.. rooms are very basic, no windows, but clean...though you can hear people passing by your room every now and then... all in all it is a good hotel to spend the weekend in...

Reviews.Title: “Tidy budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellerporirua
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotelclub.com and check-in/check-out were quick. Arrived at 10am and the room with a nice large window, was provided immediately without any fuss. Room is small but neat and tidy with clean linen and towels. Double Bed appeared new and comfortable. Buses stop right in front of the hotel which helped me save a lot by avoiding taxis. Just walking distance to Little India and good/clean restaurants. There are quite a few massage centers on Balestier Road but are scary as the massuses insist on 'happy ending' or extra. If you are a durian lover, they are available just opposite to the Hotel. Good value for money at S$ 109 per night. If you are travelling a lot in that region, they have an excellent, secured 'Left Luggage' room

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good price”
Reviews.Author: DungLuong
Reviews.Content: The room is nice but not good wifi when you are at the corner. Staff are helpful and friendly.Good location, the bus stop just right there in front of the hotel. There are many good place to eat nearby. No close MRT but the bus stop will take you to the closet mrt like novena or toa payoh. Appreciate to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quite basic”
Reviews.Author: PhilS74
Reviews.Content: Is a good solution to save money, while staying in a decent hotel. Rooms are very small and mostly without windows, toilet is quite small, MRT is not very close, but consider we are talking about Singapore, where prices are normally high. I appreciated the cleanliness and the free Internet at the lobby. In front of the Hotel, bus No.124 brings you rapidly to Orchard Road and so to the MRT. Recommended for short stay and singles.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: Laila_Isabella
Reviews.Content: Check-in is smooth. Got a deluxe room with shower & long bath. The problem is the sink has a hole wifout the water stopper thus there's a stench. Ugh! You can even see a toothbrush in it. Double Ugh! Attached a photo of it. The bathtub too has a hole at its side so you can't fill your bathtub to 3/4 full as seen in pic. Fine with me coz I use the shower. Housekeeping is just a plain tidying up. There are 3 towels, the 2 towels I used,they just fold it as seen in pix. And just spread the comforter over the bed.  Walls are thin & you can hear noises from the doorway. So far sleep is ok. No restaurants. Only 24-hour convenience store.  Value Thomson is abit better than Value Balestier in terms of food readily available & tidiness of the room.  Either way, won't stay at both hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “All little too good for Average, not good enough for Very good”
Reviews.Author: Froogle89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Value Hotel Balestier on the first night of our travelling around South-East Asia. The room was fine, very clean, very modern, the reception staff were friendly, they happily stored our bags securely after we had checked out on our last day. We booked a the cheapest room we could and so did not have a window, we were warned about this in advance so not a complaint just an observation. The bus stop is directly outside the doors and the 124 takes you to Orchard Road in about 15 mins for $1.20 per person. However to get back it is easier to walk a little bit up Scotts Road to the bus stop there as there is a one-way system down that section of Orchard Road. You could also get the bus to Newton or Novena and then get the MRT around SIngapore. Hotel was fine, however personally if I went back I would stay somewhere nearer an MRT station, or nearer the City Centre, the location does let it down a tad, it is just that little bit too far outside of the Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, modern, great location, better than friends hotels”
Reviews.Author: WyldThyme
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here and was drawn by positive reviews and the modern decor. I was not disappointed. A friend of mine booked a room in the red light district originally trying to save money, but there was some big thing that went down with tons of police, I told her to book here instead she went to their sister hotel the Thomson. The Thomson was nice because it had a pool but we generally spent our time at the beach. The Thomsons rooms were smaller and her shower flooded her room. On the day before check out we decided to check out the pool, we went up for no more than 30 mins, when we returned to her room house keeping had come. She had pictures downloading from her camera when we left, when we returned the computer was left untouched, but the camera was missing. When we confronted the front desk it took them a while to investigate. A few hours later they returned with the camera and said we had left it on the bed and the housekeep accidently picked it up with the linens, ya sure,,,, we know we had it downloading. I have a professional camera with a few lenses and tripods and nothing of mine was touched at Balestier and the front desk was beyond helpful. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “totally recommended”
Reviews.Author: Travelovers17
Reviews.Content: except the "tiny room", i think i have no complain about this hotel. i dont mind if they not have enough staff to serving guest, take my own bag to room 436 are not a problem with me. the best thing from d staff is they give me an extra mineral water on d room even i dont ask for that, its a little things but means a lot for us. thanx for d room service :) even not centrally located, this hotel offer easiest way to getting arround in singapore. take a bus infront your hotel and u can go anywhere. bus 124 take u to newton MRT and orchard road. i always take this bus to newton MRT and go everywhere from here. to go back, follow direction to scoots road. bus 125 take you to boon keng MRT, cross d road and u will find d famous "boon tong kee", if u like to explore more, there is a traditional market behind "boon tong kee" its offer you the other side of singapore and an original singapore cheap dishes :) bus 145 take you direct to vivo city, go to 3rd level u will find train to sentosa island and universal studio. this hotel really a good option for "value" traveller and 4 who doesnt matter with d "size".

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the pennies”
Reviews.Author: yssunil
Reviews.Content: * Rooms are very small.. May be a 8ft * 8ft.. IF you chose the standard room, you will not get any windows.. For windows you will have to pay 20SGD extra which is Crap policy. * Bathrooms are too small. Mighty bodies cannot take bath. * The property is neat but people are not so accomodating. No one to help with your luggages. You have to drag it all the way up. * For getting wifi password, I had to walk down to reception which is unimaginable. * No breakfast policy * locations is superb. Balestier road has so many hotels nearby. Prime property to stay

Reviews.Title: “a good value accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JaneJ2010
Reviews.Content: Visiting Singapore for the first time, I simply could not picture how the layout of this city only knowing everything is very expensive. I wanted to find a hotel with reasonable price and convenient location near the city center and came cross Value Hotel Balestier. It is located just outside the city center, with bus stop right in front of the hotel. There are bus number 124, 124A, 125, 130, 139, 145 and NR5 taking you to the different places. And a short bus ride (10-20 minutes, depending on the traffic) will get you to the central business district or the popular Orchard Rd shopping belt. From Changi airport, by taxi it took about 30 minutes to get us to the hotel. There is 24-hour store nearby especially convenient for those arrive late at night wishing for food and there is also a bank and several food courts not to far away. Hotel provides High-speed Internet access in public areas and the front desk people were friendly and helpful. We had a stand room, clean but very small and there is no window. Bathroom is small with a simple showerhead on the wall, be prepared to see the wet floor after taking shower. The room has a thin wall; so do lower TV volume if you stay up late. The strong point in the room is the very firm and comfortable bed. There are two free bottles of water, instant coffee and tea bags every day. It also provides hair dryer and basic toiletry; towels are new and clean. Over all, Value Hotel Balestier is a good value accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Hideous "Value" hotel!”
Reviews.Author: birdwithoutleg
Reviews.Content: I have never spend so much to stay in such a terrible hotel before. Room is without window which i already knew, but i didnt expect molded ceiling, with greens and browns above my head when i walk and sleep in the room, it is so creepy! I have stay in room without window before but there is nothing like this. The room is poorly ventilated, smelly, with water droplet accumulate on the floor in the morning due to humidity. as for the cleanliness of the room, the pillow case is stained, phone cord is full of dirty with ants traveling up and down and unidentified stain. It is so horrible!!! The staff is friendly enough and quite helpful but it didnt help with the poor condition of the room, which is what we pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: klingkit
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is clean. Although it's not spacious it has a bench to put your luggage. The bathroom is small, they provide towel, soap, toothbrush, hairdryer. 2 bottles mineral water, coffee and tea are provided daily. with a price similiar with other cheap chain hotel, value hotel is better in service and quality. The downside is the location and dining facilities. It's not near an MRT, in front of the hotel is a bus stop. You just need to know which bus to take. the closest MRT is Lavender. just take bus No. 145 to and from the MRT. There's no dining facilities in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sette_G
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 2 kids. The hotel rooms are quite small but the queen-sized bed and the day bed can accommodate us. Although with the room size, it can be quite difficult for 4 persons, even children, to move around when the luggage are placed on the floor. The bathroom is tiny, by any standard. It is clean but can be quite messy and dangerous after a shower because there is no rubber mat provided. Coffee and tea making facilities are provided and 2 bottles of water are provided daily. The staff are helpful but not all. There are those who have a ready smile when approached for some questions and there are also staff who can be quite unapproachable. The location is a little far from the regular sight-seeing spots but the bus stop is right in front of the hotel so transportation is not a problem. There are 2 convenient stores located beside and in front of the hotel. All in all, we are quite satisfied considering the hotel rates but we are extra careful in using the bathroom specially with the kids. But for our next visit in Singapore we may look for hotels nearer the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: ayjk
Reviews.Content: Paid SGD127 per night via AsiaRooms for a rather tiny, windowless room. However, most of everything else was good. The room and bed were clean, nice TV with several channels, clean towels. The person at reception was very kind to let us check in early at 11am with no additional charges. The location is nothing much to shout about if you're a tourist, but its worthwhile having a look around a real, living Singaporean neighbourhood with cheap eateries. A tip for anyone using the MRT: the nearest station is Toa Payoh, which is about 4 stops away from the hotel on bus 145 (reliable frequency of service, as always in Singapore). From the airport, get off at Lavender station and use the 145 as well (12 stops to the hotel), heading towards Toa Payoh. Only real gripe was with the bathroom, which was designed in such a way that everytime the shower is used, the entire bathroom would effectively be flooded.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Just Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dimariofanco
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is typically small like most hotel rooms in Singapore. They offer no frill, just a clean bed and tiny bathroom. The bathroom room is small even for Asian, so Westerner, good luck! Well, at least it's much more affordable than other mid range hotel. Staff is friendly enough and can't expect more. They're typical Singaporean, business like and barely smile! Also, forget to mention, the wall between rooms is so thin that any noise from your neighbor you can hear them

Reviews.Title: “Affordable accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Veronica1984
Reviews.Content: Value Hotel serves exactly like its namesake, as accomodation in Singapore is not exactly the most affordable, Value Hotel provides the comfort of basic necessities at a relatively affordable price. Paid SGD109 for a standard room (without window) that has air conditioning, flat screen tv, hot water, towels and basic amenities. The room is relatively small but very clean and should really just serve you as a place to sleep and shower. The only slight problem i had were the thin walls meaning if you intend to sleep in, you may be interrupted by noises from the hallways (i.e. footsteps, doors closing, etc). The hotel is near Novena MRT which is possible to walk (15-20 mins at a leisurely pace) or you can hop on a bus that comes by every 15 mins to take you to the MRT (2 stops away). Though i personally would prefer if it was closer to the MRT station. There isn't a restaurant at the hotel but there are many hawker, food courts nearby and right next to the hotel is a 24 hour convenience mart. Overall, it is a good option if you do not want to stay at a backpacker joint and want the luxury of your own private toilet for the price that you're paying. No free wi-fi though.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but no dining facilities.”
Reviews.Author: profzulueta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along to another couple on a business trip arrived at VH-Balestier around 3PM on a Sunday and check-in was a breeze. They charged us for S$109 for a standard double room at the 4th floor but after seeing that the room did not have any windows we asked for one that had windows. Reception was very accommodating. They immediately transferred us to another room with a window but we had to pay another S$10.00 extra to get a room that had a view of the back street alley on the west side. Air conditioning was good so the hot afternoon sun did not really bother us. The following Monday they charged us for only S$99.00 plus S$10 extra for a room with a window. Front desk personnel were always smiling every time we talked to them and they were very helpful in getting directions. You can also rent the computers in the lobby to google for directions @ S$4.00 for half-hour use. Room is adequate for our needs with a queen-size bed that's quite comfortable, not too hard not too soft. We were able to doze off right away as there was no noise coming from the traffic outside. Hotel room door was quite secure. There's an LCD TV hanging right in front of the bed and bedside switches for the lights. There's no telephone charge for city calls. You can get an extra pillow for S$5.00. Bathrooms are average size although the whole bathroom floor can get wet as there are no shower curtains. No problem with the hot shower. Standard bathroom amenities are available. When we checked out on Tuesday morning the front desk staff agreed to have 2 medium sized luggages stored in their baggage room because we were going to Kuala Lumpur that evening minus the extra luggage. We picked it up at around 3AM Friday when we got back from KL and the front desk staff did not complain. By the way, there are 3 Value Hotels along Balestier Road in Singapore so you have to clearly inform the cab driver you want to go the Value Hotel on 218 Balestier Road otherwise you'll end up in VH-Thomson or VH Nice, both also on the same road. There are no coffee shops or restaurant facilities in the hotel so if you want to take breakfast there's a Chinese noodle house around the corner that opens at around 7AM or you can buy some snack foods and sandwiches at the 24-hour convenience store by the side entrance near the hotel lobby. Right across the hotel is a 7-11 store that's also open 24/7. The hotel provides 2 bottles of mineral water daily. There's a bus stop right in front of the hotel doorsteps so commuting to Orchard Road is only about 10 minutes ride and the bus to Vivo City in Harbour Front/ Sentosa is about 25 minutes away. There are several buses that stop every 10-15 minutes to take you to different routes. All routes are displayed in the bus stop. Overall, I would give the hotel a very satisfactory rating and I would recommend the hotel to travelers with average needs.

Reviews.Title: “Choice of Cheap traveler”
Reviews.Author: Adict_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Traveled with three friends across SEA and had a chance to stay at this hotel for four days. This is how we felt: Service: decent enough service, staff was cordial and helpful. 3/5 Room: was very tiny, though being in Singapore, we have to take what we get. Amenities provided were pretty basic. 2/5 Location: Location was not that great, though connectivity in Singapore takes care of this. 2/5 Food: Didn't try hotel food Overall Impression: Try this when you are really on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Out of my expectation”
Reviews.Author: guneingdoe
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a budget hotel in Tune Hotels style, and Value Hotel definitely exceeded that expectation. As pointed out by other travellers here, the only downside about this hotel is its location. It's nowhere near an MRT station, but I personally find buses convenient too. Just a piece of information- it's about an hour of bus ride to HarbourFront MRT and Vivocity, and about 30 mins to Bugis. The room was small, but it had all the basics such as tootbrushes, hair dryer, coffee maker etc. That's a great upgrade from no-frills hotel like Tune! A pleasant surprise is that the room also had a DVD player! It was wonderful for movie buffs like us. Free wi-fi is also available in rooms. Another great thing is that the hotel is just a short walk from the Balestier hawker centre on Whampoa Drive, which offers really good food that is priced much lower than in tourist areas. A must-try if you stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok - Location Not Great”
Reviews.Author: merego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of December 2011 for about 4 days. We arrived at about 8pm - not too late at night and check in was ok. We got to our rooms to find that the sleeping arrangement we requested (5 months before) was messed up. We requested a room for 3 but were given one double bed. This took about 3 hours to sort out by the staff by which time, after getting off an 11 hour flight and an hour trip into town from the airport, we were nackered! Staff kept saying they were working on it, we called reception several times and had to even go down to reception personally to get any response from any. Not a good start. Finally after being transferred to a new room, we discovered to were downgraded to a room with no window, we had our double bed and a matress put on the floor with a sheet over it for the third person. Not good. Couldn't be bothered complaining again. just wanted to sleep at that stage. Rooms are TINY. with all the beds, there is no room for luggage. Shower, toilet and sink are all in one. location: NOT close to any MRT station but busses are just outside. you can catch those to orchard rd. We didn't think it was convenient at all beacuse you needed to know bus routes and where to catch the busses from to go back to the hotel. next time, it would probably be better to stay closer to an MRT station. We had issues with taxis too, didn't know you had to book them or order them. All up: Good if you are just going to sleep and shower. Not good if you intend to relax and spend time in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very basic but reasonable price hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nathantran
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is typically small like most hotel rooms in Singapore. They offer no frill, just a clean bed and tiny bathroom. The bathroom room is small even for Asian, so Westerner, good luck! The room we book has no window and the price is around $77 USD. Well, at least it's much more affordable than other mid range hotel. Staff is friendly enough and can't expect more. They're typical Singaporean, business like and barely smile! Also, forget to mention, the wall between rooms is so thin that any noise from your neighbor you can hear them.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate for a stop-over”
Reviews.Author: Danya3
Reviews.Content: We must have been lucky to get a room (triple) with a huge window so we were very pleased with this hotel. The bathroom is fine, except for the tendency for everything to get wet when showering (common across Asia). Agree that a bath mat outside the bathroom door would be useful. Comfy bed and pillows plus not problem with noise from anywhere so we all slept well. We didn't have time to use the pool, but it looked nice, Location isn't much, no restaurants or (shopping type) shops around, so it wouldn't be the best place to stay for a proper Singapore visit. But it's just fine, and good value, for a short stopover. Accommodation is Singapore isn't cheap!! It's also a quick and easy taxi trip to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Hcookexh
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were allowed to check in at 8am following from a 10 hour flight from the UK. Staff were very helpful throughout our stay. Room was very clean and we used the pool to relax after our long journey. Would recommend and use again for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice box for a room without window”
Reviews.Author: PradeepPrakash
Reviews.Content: It was a clean hotel with box like rooms without window. they charge you for window, internet etc. no food is available. bathrooms are also very small. the tariff was cheaper when booked from internet rather than booking at the hotel. Will not recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the value...”
Reviews.Author: borneo-beauty
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel on my one day business trip in Singapore. The first impression that learned from this hotel is clean and neat. The hotel staff taking care of their guess in a very professional manner, polite and helpful. It took me about 25 minutes from the airport to get to this hotel, the taxi cost about SGD $ 25, that if you pay with cash, but with the credit card there will be an additional 3% fees on top of your fare cost. The room sufficient enough for me since I travel alone, but if you bring family might be too small. The bathroom tiny as well, seems like trying to match it up with the size of the room, but everything very clean and neat... A bit noisy at the time I stay at this hotel...because there's a youth sports team stay there as well....the bed pretty comfy so that's a plus to it. In the morning I did asked the front desk if there's any bakery shop close by to get some bagel, bread or pastry...but they said unfortunately there's none closer to the area, so I was a bit disappointed, hopefully next time there will be one open near by the hotel. Overall my stay in Singapore was really good! thanks to the hospitality of Value Hotel Staff! I definitely stay again in this hotel for my next short trip to Singapore... If you have a little bit time to go out, Novena Squares Mall not too far away from this hotel, it takes about 5 minutes with the taxi and cost for about SGD $ 5. and If you in Novena Squares Mall try to stop by at KOPITIAM I think it means "Coffee Time" A lot of variety of food from Korean, Chinese and more! Price is good somewhere between SGD $ 5 and up.... I walk around the mall area...pretty nice lay out....a lot of apparel and fashion shop, book store, shoes and much more..... There's a good hang out cafe like The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf co. and more! Crave for a sandwich...there's Subway as well. Singapore is always a very clean and tidy country and not to mentioned beautiful! Sincerely, Sharon E. Jakarta-Indonesia

Reviews.Title: “At par”
Reviews.Author: Debodi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean but badly located. Small room with a comfy bed but without windows. The only good thing of the hotel was just the price.

Reviews.Title: “Name of the hotel stands for its value”
Reviews.Author: HarshaVardhan
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked and stayed in this hotel to watch Forumula 1 race in Singapore in September 2010. We stayed in this hotel for 4 days. We went during the peak season and hence paid a premium which is normal across all hotels in Singapore during F1 season. Some of the reviews pointed that the hotel staff were less friendly but I staunchly disagree as the hotel staff were very friendly though out the stay. We reached the hotel by 8.00 am and the published check in time was 2.00pm. However, the hotel staff alloted the room and we checked in early with out any problem. The rooms were tidy and the house keeping staff ensured the room remained that way through out our stay. The hotel entrance opens to the main road and bus stop and in Singapore if your hotel is located to MRT or bus stop you can be rest assured that your stay would be that much more plesant. Taxis are easily available from and to the hotel. On the negative side, the rooms and bathrooms are very small. However, since we only stayed in the room during the nights, this did NOT matter. The hotel has no room service but Singapore has lot of eatries that are open 24 hours so even this did not matter. The hotel entrance has a 7-11 store that is also open 24 hours. Opposite to the hotel there are a couple of restaturants that are open till early hours. There is also a good spa bang opposite to the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located - orchard road by taxi costs apprx S$ 6-7. Overall, if you are visiting Singapore and dont intend to pamper yourself in the coziness of your room and only want to hit the streets - this is a hotel i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “No Carpet floor?”
Reviews.Author: Efleet
Reviews.Content: overall the hotel sercives is ok, hotel is quite new in the sense that they just started running the business less then 2 years guess. BUT, why no carpet floor? AND the washroom is bit too small. HELLO!! what to do, it's a 2 star hotel afterall!

Reviews.Title: “Look for other hotels, NOT this one.”
Reviews.Author: kwleong
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can think of is the hotel is clean. Other than that: 1.) People working at the hotel are NOT friendly at all, very bad service and not helpful 2.) Location is bad. Far from MRT station and not convinient 3.) Room is extremely small. No window. No cupboard 4.) Wall is so thin that you can hear kids or the hotel staff walking or talking to each other early in the morning while you are still sleeping I will not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “dreadfull”
Reviews.Author: ochre101
Reviews.Content: from the bored young desk staff to the claustrophobic rooms not to forget the bed bugs which are still healing to the noise factor of the constant clip clop on the tiled hallways to the loud inappropriate choice of music i cannot say one single positive thing about this horrible hotel was awefull. thank god for the 24hr shop next dorr with lovely knowledgable staff DONT STAY HERE ITS THE WORST HOTEL IN SINGAPORE

Reviews.Title: “Best spore value,but only if ur out most of the time”
Reviews.Author: missyaliaa
Reviews.Content: To sum up our stay in the standard room (no windows,double bed), it was just nice for us who just needed to come back for sleep after a city trip. Concur with most that the bed is comfy (soft pillows,good mattress), the room is small (a tad smaller than the Tune Hotel chain) and the toilet does not have any dry area since the shower is right in front of the toilet bowl & next to the sink. If we had to complain , it would be of the tiny ants we saw crawling on the sink and the thin walls (our friends could here our phone ringing across the hall). However with the price paid (SG-standards), it is good value with the basic comforts provided - vanity mirror,table & chair, hair-dryer,toilettries,bottled water,individually controlled AC,daily turndown service,towels,flat screen tv, 4-hook coat hanger, modern furnish. (Note: there's no wardrobe/safe/luggage compartment) Accessibility-wise, the best way to travel when staying here is by bus / taxi with a bus-stop right at the hotel doorstep. MRT is not walking distance. To share, flagging-down taxis during rush hours here is quite a challenge. Best to call-up a taxi or ask the hotel to call one for you. Also, you (as well as some taxi drivers apparently) might get confused which Value Hotel is which since there are 3 of them in the same stretch. Just tell them it's the one opposite Quality Hotel. If you're not claustrophobic , not a light sleeper , travel mostly by bus/taxi and not into dodgy looking hotels but on a budget, I'd reccomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Budget yet comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMomma7
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights. It was a SG$27 taxi cab from the airport. SG$ 6-8 cab ride to orchard and less than SG$ 2 for a bus ride. The beds were very comfortable and so were the pillows. We expected though to see a bed properly arranged by check in time. Looked like it was hurriedly cleaned. The walls looked old but what you see in their hotel photos are not quite the same with the real thing. Room was very small, we couldn't hardly move around. Staff were not too friendly. They shouldn't be in the hospitality industry if they don't like to smile. But the location of the hotel is very good with Whampoa market behind it (parallel street) with wonderful local food. Plus the bus stop right across and more restaurants surrounding the place. I'd recommend it if you're on a tight budget. It was about SG $80 per night with SC and taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Very thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: daphseow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights, simply because we needed a budget hotel. We stayed in a room with no windows, but the room was clean and surprisingly not musty. Very small room with basic amenities, but it is okay if you don't plan to stay in all the time. The main thing that really annoyed me during my stay there was the very thin walls. I could hear every little noise from outside, next door and upstairs. It did not help that there were guests on the same floor that talked really loudly and had children running up and down the corridors at 8 in the morning (and the next day, it happened at 5.30am!). Also, I wasn't too happy with the location of the hotel. It is quite far from the nearest MRT (you will definitely have to take a bus or cab to the station). I really don't think I would ever want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value at all !”
Reviews.Author: nairajay10
Reviews.Content: For a 100USD I thought it's not good value at all.I wanted a budget accomodation for a night so I chose the Valuehotel over the other options available namely the Hotel 81 and Fragrance (which are in every area of Singapore) allthough the Valuehotel was 20% more expensive I still chose it because it's reputation was better that the other two.Now that I think of it all of them fall into the same category. The first thing that hits you once you walk into the hotel is the overwhelming room freshner that they use it does'nt hide the bad smell instead makes it worse , the passage to the room is narrow and the room itself makes you feel as if you are living in a small box (no windows) the bathroom is small as well and was not cleaned (still had hair on the drain) the bed was dirty as well.It's not close to any MRT station so you need to take a cab. The other much economical option is to take the bus (number 124 stops just in front of the hotel and 1 SGD would get you to 'Newton MRT' station from where you can connect to anywhere in Singapore including the airport and vice versa)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of HOUSEKEEPING who STEALS”
Reviews.Author: delectrifying
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel. Since it is a budget , they DO NOT compensate you for lost items, instead they BLAME the guest for not securely keeping the items. Police report been made. Item lost is trivial, but the insult is not. Very bad on how management handles the situation. Not recmonded hotel, but if u insist ... make sure everything is locked INSIDE your lugage compartment.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good budget hotel and it was clean!”
Reviews.Author: Downsouthaddict
Reviews.Content: April 12th 2010 : Well when we entered the hotel we had already booked it online. They gave us a room with no windows. Then my boyfriend requested for a room with windows which costs us extra SD$ 10 a day. Which was fine i guessed. The second room was much better! had a windown and the room was pretty small but nice! We didnt spend much time in the room since we were always out. But the hotel was close by to a food place past Value hotel nice. And had a cheers downstairs along with an atm. The bus stand ws close by too. Staff were very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you seriously need to save money”
Reviews.Author: mazmohad
Reviews.Content: Only if you seriously want to save money for the night. Our scenario was that we needed a place to sleep to catch a early morning flight due to a last minute change in schedule. Don't expect much, its a no frills / budget hotel, no bathroom accessories, really tiny room, a bit humid smell and no restaurants. A walk for 10 mins will get you McDonalds and KFC. There is a bus stop right in front that connects to few metro stations. No tour buses around and not close to any downtown. Request for a DVD room if you have dvds to kill time. TV is the only entertainment. There is a grocery store for quick snacks like chips or soft drinks. Not recommended for couples although we did not have any issues but unless it is for a serious cheap budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Think Walk-in wardrobe”
Reviews.Author: Jimten
Reviews.Content: The twin bed rooms in this Hotel are the tiniest I've ever seen. There are no windows and no hanging space. Likewise, the bathroom is very small and when you shower the bathroom is awash with water and takes ages to dry. Fortunately, we were transiting Singapore - this is not a suitable place for a holiday stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: DingLoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and moden room, you pay for what you get, the room is small, and the bath room is the smallest I ever seen in all the hotels. Those who are looking for big and roomy room, this may not suit you. The location is ok, walking distance to shops, MRT station and bus station.

Reviews.Title: “value hotel nice,it was not really 'nice'”
Reviews.Author: vengeful
Reviews.Content: me and my friends went shopping on that day and decided to stay one night,the price and the service was good but in the hotel itself we couldn't see any toilet,its actually at the backdoor,and it was so smelly,the tissue box was empty...and was so messy with all the cleaner items like mop,detergent etc,don't they have any store??? about the room,it was fine but small...it doesn't matter as i was given a dvd player and the bed was very comfortable...but if were to stay there to sleep...better get a earplugs as it was noisy because this hotel is just by the roadside...

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel Thomson...Lovely hotel - pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: LillyBu
Reviews.Content: Value Hotel Thomson is a newly opened hotel, part of the Value Hotel chain. It is located on Balestier road, on the opposite end to Value Hotel Balestier. Our taxi driver took us to the wrong hotel by mistake, as they were both located on Balestier road. We went to check-in and was told by the hotel staff we were in the wrong hotel, however they have rooms available as they opened only 2 weeks ago. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful and showed us around the hotel and the room we could stay at. We were given a room on the 11th floor with a WINDOW!!! We decided to stay at this hotel as we couldn't be bother to get another cab, so he called Value Hotel Balestier to cancel our reservation there. The rooms are small, but has all the facilities one needs. The bathroom takes a bit of getting us to, as it was a walk in wet room (ie. toilet, wash hand basin and shower all in one space) Being a new hotel, everything was nice and clean...they even have a swimming pool and gym facilities, which the other one didn't. The best thing about this hotel, besides being relatively cheap for staying in Singapore was that the transport facilities were brilliant. The bus stop was right outside the hotel and which took us to the city centre. Also the staff were amazing friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: DLIT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Value Hotel Balestier for 5 (sleepless) nights. We know Singapore quite well and we are perfectly aware of the prices of a basic accommodation with a decent bathroom in a serviced area. We tried this place because of the extremely cheap price and as always "you get what you pay for". The walls in this place are so thin that you can hear word by word what the people next room says and we could hear all nights "the ladies at work". One night we went downstair to find girls hanging around. Not that I really bother about it, but I bother not to sleep because of it. Said that the room was even smaller than average in Singapore (!!!?!!) with the window locked but very clean with bedsheets and towels changed daily. The location is far from the turistic area but it's nice to walk around to see the real Singapore sometime. A short bus ride can get you nearly everywhere. Probably a good choice for a stop over but nothing more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: becwalsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night. It is brand new and very nice for the price. The staff are incredibly friendly and very very helpful. The only slight downfall is the location. It is a little bit out of the way if you only have a day to explore like us. The taxi ride was very cheap from the airport too - only $14

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: habdog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Value Hotel Balestier for 2 nights. It is a new hotel and was very clean, very small and very basic. There is a queen size bed, a very small bench come vanity unit and a flat screen TV on the wall. No bed side tables, no wardrobe (just a couple of hooks on the wall), no desk, no bench for bags etc. A/C was very good and the hot shower was fantastic. For what I wanted it was ideal (for a couple of nights where I was out all of the day). However if you were going to be there for a longer period it would probably be quite cramped with no room to spread out, especially for a couple. The front desk was very helpful with bus routes, internet etc. There is a mini mart in the same building and places to eat nearby. It is located on the outskirts of the inner city area (about 5 minutes bus ride further out from Little India) however at the front door there are frequent buses that seem to cover a fair few options into various parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Value stay at value prices”
Reviews.Author: bluecider
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a clean, budget friendly hotel to stay in for 6 nights. We liked that the bus stop is a few steps from the lobby and that they only accept overnight guests. There's a convenience store just outside so you can grab something to eat quickly if you're hungry. The room itself is a bit on the small side but manageable. A comfy queen size bed with very nice white sheets takes up most of the bedroom. There's no closet for your clothes nor a mini-ref. There's a long tiled area/bench (the span of 1 wall) where you can put your trolley/bags so it will be at chair height. The bathroom is square in size with toilet and shower area close together. There's strong water pressure with hot water so I didn't mind that it was on the smallish side. The bedsheets and towels are changed everyday. We had it done while we were out and we never lost any of our stuff, so kudos to the cleaning team. Only reason I didn't put 5 smileys for cleanliness was because I noticed they didn't sweep the floor the whole time we were there. There were dust bunnies around the bed. Also, there's a distinct smell in the hallway, like its unventilated. The room uses keycard system so A/C was attached to that. Just ask for another key so even if you go separate destinations you won't need to worry about getting in. Location wise its around Novena/Lavander area. You need to take the bus to go to Orchard. Its actually better to take the bus to go to the city rather than look for the nearest mrt station. Travel time is around 20 mins. Don't forget to try the chicken rice at Wee Nam Kee which is just in front of the Catholic Church on Novena. Just ask the reception how to get there. They had a welcoming reception service. We had some take away food and wanted to have it heated and the receptionist there reheated it for us immediately. =D Overall, for the price and the convenience, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, basic”
Reviews.Author: StChristopherUK
Reviews.Content: This is a very new (or completely refurbished) hotel so everything looked nice and smelled fresh. Had a very comfortable 1 nights stay. Reception were friendly and courtious. It is not very close to an MRT station but Novena can be reached in approx 20 mins walk. The buses also stop outside but taxis are frequent also. There are plenty of places to choose to eat within a short walking distance. I would be happy to have a short stay in this hotel again (if no more than what I paid which I think was around S$69).

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: siawendy
Reviews.Content: The interior of the hotel's brand new and good. We booked 2 rooms, 1 with twin beds & another with queen size bed, and the room are very small but i don't have problem with that. Please be aware that there's no closet, so if you are bringing fine clothes, pack along a couple of hangers. There are 2 issues we encountered, 1st was we've been having problem sleeping throughout the nights. We can hear people walking in and out, and doors shutting even at wee hours. It's been 3 restless nights despite that we are dead tiring after the daytime activities. 2ndly, the floor was never clean, i assumed... as i see dirt & dust on the floor and underneath the bed. I have to literately jump to the bed after shower to prevent my feet getting dust on the bed & sheets. *the floors are tiled, not carpeted, that's why the noises are bouncing everywhere. So you may have to consider another hotel if you are a light-sleeper
